\vspace{2pt}
\begin{minipage}{0.98\linewidth}
\footnotesize\raggedright\textit{Notes:} \textit{n/a} denotes ``not applicable'' (handshake messages are padded by SBP1 rather than SBP2). \texttt{-} denotes ``not observed'' in the sampled protocol trace. The $>$cap rate is computed as the fraction of frames where (payload bytes + SBP2 header) exceeds the configured cap; such frames are passed through without additional bucket padding (beyond the fixed SBP2 header), so overhead may round to near-zero and entropy reflects unquantized size variability for that fraction.
\end{minipage}
